result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew J Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.
Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew J Jones

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Matthew J Jones

Prior: 104 Lakecrest Drive, #208, Beaver Dam, WI 53916

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with alleged victim, SNP or her residence.  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not go on the premises at 104 Lakecrest Drive, Beaver Dam, WI.  Defendant shall not possess any firearms.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

(1:07) Defendant Matthew J Jones in custody via video with attorney Jaclyn R. Shelton (jail only).  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. Def. stands mute; State requests $3,000 Cash w/conditions; Atty. Shelton response; Court enters Not Guilty plea. RD 4/11/16 at 3:30pm & JT 5/11/16 at 8:30am in Br. 3; Court sets $1,000 CASH Bond with conditions: Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with S.N.P. or her residence at 104 Lakecrest Drive.  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not possess any firearms.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.
